intro: Sida ambatensis, commonly known as the Madagascar mallow, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Sida ambatensis is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
